response.answer_text: “Is 2020 the future?” Yes, until it’s the present. Then eventually it’ll be the past. But it really depends on when you’re reading this. If you’re reading it now as I’m writing it, it’s November 27, 2019, so it’s the future. In 40 days it’ll be sometime in January 2020 (I’m too lazy to count) so 2020 will be a current reality. Assuming we get there, that is - maybe time will stop and start to rewind on December 31, 2019. Or maybe that’s already happening and we’re all living with the reversal of time’s arrow. It’s hard to tell…

Yes, since this is November of 2019, just before Thanksgiving here in the US, 2020 has not arrived and would be considered to be in the future. As was 2022 which is the date you gave in a previous question you asked about who the president was in 2022.
